Forgive me if this is the wrong topic in which to post this (mods feel free to move). I've searched to see if anyone has discussed the CRACK program. A brief description: it's a private program which pays people who choose to use drugs $200 to sterilize themselves. The main target drug was crack in the past, but I'm sure they wouldn't reject someone whose preferred drug was heroin, cocaine, etc.
 The program was started by a woman who adopted several children from a mother on crack. After the umpteenth child, she thought of preventing an unwanted life being brought into the world.
 This is different from the eugenics movement or any goverment mandated program as it is voluntary. Some objections are that it's not helping drug addicts get treatment, or that it can't be voluntary if a person's using drugs. Some proponents argue that many addicts do not want treatment or that a person who cannot sign a contract should not be entrusted to raise a child.
 I'm all for the program. I believe that for every parent who quits crack and becomes a great role model, etc, there are several others who do not quit, will not become good parents, and will inevitably instill the addiction cycle anew with their own children. Even if they quit, I believe the underlying issues will remain, barring them from becoming good parents anyway.
 What are your thoughts? For or against? What modifications are needed to make you support it if previously against?
